column4: My keyboard is having issues. It won't work in KDE, but it will work in GNOME. ans this problem only started a few minutest ago
check your keyboard connector
The keyboard works in GNOME though
It is definately no the keyboard
consider that your connector may have moved or that the cable may be damages
I don't have a clue then
I have tried and retried several times
usb ?
PS/2
did you try to change the keyboard settings in kde ? you might have accicentaly removed it or someting
no. It was working one minute, and then i went to get something and when I came back it didn't work
I assume you tried to reboot ?
yes, several times
does it work in recovery mode ?
let me see. Just a minute
recovery mode didn't work
I'm stumped, are both kubuntu and ubuntu on the same hdd ?  try from ubuntu  sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop maybe it will restore files that might be missing
I am running kde on ubuntu
same answer then
try reformulating your question
do you mean use one computer's internet on another, or use two seperate internet connections on the same comp to speed up your transfers ?
I want to use one computer's internet on another
ok , I think you need to use firestarter to do that,  but I'm not sure,  you might want to try asking in #networking
